docs.snippet: Swiss voters would rather maintain close economic ties with the European Union than adopt immigration curbs that could jeopardize Switzerland's access to the EU single market, a survey published on Sunday showed....
docs.lead_paragraph: Swiss voters would rather maintain close economic ties with the European Union than adopt immigration curbs that could jeopardize Switzerland's access to the EU single market, a survey published on Sunday showed.

headline.main: Swiss Favor Close EU Ties Over Immigration Curbs: Survey
headline.print_headline: Swiss Favor Close EU Ties Over Immigration Curbs: Survey

docs.snippet: Nationals of Saudi Arabia, Morocco, Lebanon and Libya were among those killed in a gun attack at a packed nightclub in Istanbul on Sunday, Turkish Family Minister Fatma Betul Sayan Kaya was quoted by the state-run Anadolu news agency as saying....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nationals of Saudi Arabia, Morocco, Lebanon and Libya were among those killed in a gun attack at a packed nightclub in Istanbul on Sunday, Turkish Family Minister Fatma Betul Sayan Kaya was quoted by the state-run Anadolu news agency as saying.

headline.main: Citizens of Several Arab Nations Among Istanbul Attack Victims: Minister
headline.print_headline: Citizens of Several Arab Nations Among Istanbul Attack Victims: Minister

docs.snippet: French car sales rose 5.8 percent in December, according to industry data published on Sunday, closing a second consecutive year of strong growth in Europe's third-biggest auto market....
docs.lead_paragraph: French car sales rose 5.8 percent in December, according to industry data published on Sunday, closing a second consecutive year of strong growth in Europe's third-biggest auto market.

headline.main: French Auto Market Ends Second Rebound Year With December Gain
headline.print_headline: French Auto Market Ends Second Rebound Year With December Gain

docs.snippet: Syrian government warplanes resumed their bombardment of a rebel-held valley near Damascus on Sunday after nearly 24 hours with no air raids, a rebel official and monitors said, during the third day of a fragile ceasefire....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian government warplanes resumed their bombardment of a rebel-held valley near Damascus on Sunday after nearly 24 hours with no air raids, a rebel official and monitors said, during the third day of a fragile ceasefire.

headline.main: Syrian Warplanes Strike Near Damascus During Fragile Truce
headline.print_headline: Syrian Warplanes Strike Near Damascus During Fragile Truce

docs.snippet: Islamic State militants have aspirations to launch mass-casualty chemical attacks on targets in Britain and elsewhere in Europe, the British security minister said in a newspaper interview published on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants have aspirations to launch mass-casualty chemical attacks on targets in Britain and elsewhere in Europe, the British security minister said in a newspaper interview published on Sunday.

headline.main: UK Minister Sees Threat of Islamic State Chemical Attack in Britain
headline.print_headline: UK Minister Sees Threat of Islamic State Chemical Attack in Britain

docs.snippet: An Israeli woman was among the dead in an Istanbul nightclub attack that killed at least 39 people, the Israeli Foreign Ministry said on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Israeli woman was among the dead in an Istanbul nightclub attack that killed at least 39 people, the Israeli Foreign Ministry said on Sunday.

headline.main: Israeli Woman Killed in Istanbul Nightclub Attack: Israeli Foreign Ministry
headline.print_headline: Israeli Woman Killed in Istanbul Nightclub Attack: Israeli Foreign Ministry

docs.snippet: Gunmen armed with automatic rifles and pistols stormed a Bahraini prison Sunday, killing a police officer and freeing 10 inmates convicted on terrorism charges, police said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gunmen armed with automatic rifles and pistols stormed a Bahraini prison Sunday, killing a police officer and freeing 10 inmates convicted on terrorism charges, police said.

headline.main: Gunmen Kill Police Officer, Free Inmates at Bahrain Prison
headline.print_headline: Gunmen Kill Police Officer, Free Inmates at Bahrain Prison

docs.snippet: Police in Florence say a bomb squad officer lost an eye and had to have a hand amputated after a suspicious package he was examining exploded before dawn Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police in Florence say a bomb squad officer lost an eye and had to have a hand amputated after a suspicious package he was examining exploded before dawn Sunday.

headline.main: Italy Bomb Squad Expert Loses Eye, Hand to Exploding Package
headline.print_headline: Italy Bomb Squad Expert Loses Eye, Hand to Exploding Package

docs.snippet: A policeman was killed on Sunday when armed men attacked a prison in Bahrain, freeing several convicted inmates, the interior ministry said, in what it described as a terrorist act....
docs.lead_paragraph: A policeman was killed on Sunday when armed men attacked a prison in Bahrain, freeing several convicted inmates, the interior ministry said, in what it described as a terrorist act.

headline.main: Policeman Killed, Inmates Freed in Attack on Bahrain Prison
headline.print_headline: Policeman Killed, Inmates Freed in Attack on Bahrain Prison

docs.snippet: Spain's economic growth may have exceeded the 3.2 percent pace officially projected by the government for 2016, Economy Minister Luis de Guindos said in a radio interview on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Spain's economic growth may have exceeded the 3.2 percent pace officially projected by the government for 2016, Economy Minister Luis de Guindos said in a radio interview on Sunday.

headline.main: Spanish Economy May Have Beaten 3.2 Percent Goal in 2016-Minister
headline.print_headline: Spanish Economy May Have Beaten 3.2 Percent Goal in 2016-Minister
